metadata.title: DocumentGroupLaunchScene | Apple Developer Documentation
metadata.author: Apple Inc.
metadata.summary: Apple Developer Documentation page for DocumentGroupLaunchScene, a SwiftUI structure that provides a launch scene for document-based applications. The documentation covers platform availability, initializers, relationships, and related types for configuring document launch experiences.
metadata.copyright: Copyright 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

content.iconDescription: Document icon to the left of text

content.text: A launch scene for document-based applications.
You can use this launch scene alongside DocumentGroup scenes. If you don't implement a DocumentGroup in the app declaration, you can get the same design by implementing a DocumentLaunchView.

If you don't provide the title of the scene, it displays the application name. If you don't provide the actions builder, the scene has the default "Create Document" action that creates new documents. To customize the document launch experience, you can replace the standard screen background and title, add decorative views, and add custom actions.

A DocumentGroupLaunchScene configures the document browser on the bottom sheet to open content types from all the document groups in the app definition. A DocumentGroupLaunchScene also configures the document groups to create documents of the first content type that your application can create and write.
For more information, see FileDocument.writableContentTypes and ReferenceFileDocument.writableContentTypes.

definition.text: Creates a launch scene for document-based applications with a title, a set of actions, and a background.
Creates a launch scene for document-based applications with a title, a set of actions, a background, and a background accessory view.
Creates a launch scene for document-based applications with a title, a set of actions, and a background.
Creates a launch scene for document-based applications with a title, a set of actions, a background, and an overlay accessory view.
Creates a launch scene for document-based applications with a title, a background style, and a set of actions.
Creates a launch scene for document-based applications with a title, a background style, a set of actions, and a background accessory view.
Creates a launch scene for document-based applications with a title, a background style, a set of actions, and background and overlay accessory views.
Creates a launch scene for document-based applications with a title, a background style, a set of actions, and an overlay accessory view.
A view to present when launching document-related user experience.
A proxy for access to the frame of the scene and its title view.
The default actions for the document group launch scene and the document launch view.
A button that creates and opens new documents.
A Box that allows setting its Document base not requiring the caller to know the exact types of the box and its base.

content.text: To submit feedback on documentation, visit Feedback Assistant.

pages.pageSummary: Apple Developer Documentation page for DocumentGroupLaunchScene, a SwiftUI structure for creating launch scenes in document-based applications. The page provides the type declaration, platform availability (iOS 18.0+, iPadOS 18.0+, Mac Catalyst 18.0+, visionOS 2.0+), an overview explaining its usage with DocumentGroup and customization options, eight initializer variants for different background and accessory view configurations, protocol conformance to Scene, and related types for configuring document launch experiences.

crossPageElements.runningFooters: Apple Developer footer with platform links, resources, and legal information

sections.title: Type Declaration
sections.summary: Declares DocumentGroupLaunchScene as a generic struct with Actions conforming to View, available on iOS 18.0+, iPadOS 18.0+, Mac Catalyst 18.0+, and visionOS 2.0+.

sections.title: Overview
sections.summary: Explains how DocumentGroupLaunchScene works alongside DocumentGroup scenes, describes default behaviors (application name as title, Create Document action), customization options (background, title, decorative views, custom actions), and how it configures the document browser and content types.

sections.title: Topics

subsections.title: Initializers
subsections.summary: Lists eight initializer variants: four with background parameter and four with backgroundStyle parameter, each optionally including backgroundAccessoryView and/or overlayAccessoryView parameters.

sections.summary: Contains the Initializers subsection with all available initialization methods.

sections.title: Relationships
sections.summary: Shows that DocumentGroupLaunchScene conforms to the Scene protocol.

sections.title: See Also
sections.summary: Lists related types for configuring document launch experience: DocumentLaunchView (view for launching), DocumentLaunchGeometryProxy (frame access proxy), DefaultDocumentGroupLaunchActions (default actions), NewDocumentButton (document creation button), and DocumentBaseBox (protocol for document base setting).

semanticStructure.documentFlow: The document follows Apple's standard developer documentation structure: starting with type identification (structure label, name, subtitle), followed by platform availability badges and the Swift declaration. The Overview section explains the component's purpose and usage patterns. Topics section lists all initializers organized by parameter combinations. Relationships section shows protocol conformance. See Also section provides links to related types. The footer contains comprehensive site navigation and legal information.

keyTerms.definition: A SwiftUI structure that provides a launch scene for document-based applications, configuring the document browser and content types.
A SwiftUI scene type for document-based applications that DocumentGroupLaunchScene works alongside.
A view to present when launching document-related user experience, alternative to DocumentGroupLaunchScene when not implementing DocumentGroup.
A SwiftUI protocol that DocumentGroupLaunchScene conforms to.
Generic type parameter constrained to View, representing custom actions in the launch scene.
An optional decorative view placed behind the main content in the launch scene.
An optional decorative view placed over the main content in the launch scene.
An alternative to background parameter for styling the launch scene background.
Property that defines content types a file document can create and write.
Property that defines content types a reference file document can create and write.

keyFindings: DocumentGroupLaunchScene is available starting iOS 18.0+, iPadOS 18.0+, Mac Catalyst 18.0+, and visionOS 2.0+
If no title is provided, the scene displays the application name
If no actions builder is provided, the scene shows a default 'Create Document' action
The scene configures document browser on a bottom sheet to open content types from all document groups
Documents are created with the first content type the application can create and write
Eight initializer variants exist: four with background parameter and four with backgroundStyle parameter
Customization options include: screen background, title, decorative views, and custom actions
DocumentLaunchView provides similar functionality when not using DocumentGroup

relatedTypes.name: DocumentLaunchView
relatedTypes.description: A view to present when launching document-related user experience.

relatedTypes.name: DocumentLaunchGeometryProxy
relatedTypes.description: A proxy for access to the frame of the scene and its title view.

relatedTypes.name: DefaultDocumentGroupLaunchActions
relatedTypes.description: The default actions for the document group launch scene and the document launch view.

relatedTypes.name: NewDocumentButton
relatedTypes.description: A button that creates and opens new documents.

relatedTypes.name: DocumentBaseBox
relatedTypes.description: A Box that allows setting its Document base not requiring the caller to know the exact types of the box and its base.

designDecisions: Scene uses generic Actions parameter to allow custom view-based actions
Provides both background (View) and backgroundStyle (ShapeStyle) variants for flexibility
Separates background and overlay accessory views for layered decorative content
Falls back to application name when no title provided for sensible defaults
Includes default Create Document action when no custom actions specified
